command: docker run --rm --volumes-from redis01 ubuntu bash -lc 'if [ -d /data ]; then find /data -type f -print0 | xargs -0 -r shred -n 2 -z -u; dd if=/dev/zero of=/data/.wipe bs=10M || true; sync; rm -f /data/.wipe; fi'
explanation: Targets the Redis data directory exposed by redis01, securely overwriting and deleting data files and then zero-filling free space to remove remnants, followed by sync.
rationale_steps: Shred all data files with multiple passes and delete
Fill remaining free space with zeros to wipe slack space
